artist: Designer: Gerrit Rietveld; Maker: Gerard A. van de Groenekan
creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: back, seat and terminals lacquered in red, blue and yellow
image_copyright: © Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F PICTORIGHT%2C The Netherlands
markings: branded underneath seat: [H.G.M. / G. A. v.d. Groenekan / De Bilt Nederland]
text:
The angled seat and back offer the comfort of a lounge chair. But that wasn’t what the designer had in mind—he created the chair to explore the idea of furniture as abstract sculpture. 

The red and blue planes seem to zoom through space before stopping near each other without touching. They rest on a collection of black legs, side rails, and arms with yellow ends, a kind of scaffolding to support the back and seat.
title: "Red-Blue" chair
